data.title: When change the tab or input in the chrome, the VSCode will change the content of blank tab.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open the VSCode and close all the tab, only some introduction left, it looks like this
![2017-08-17 9 34 01 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12438996/29392248-3e6d8d44-832f-11e7-9017-50c0689ebf9a.png)

2.And the Chrome is running in the other screen, when you do some operations in the Chrome, the content in the VSCode '切换终端 ^`' will change to '切换终端 未绑定'. 

I wonder whether there is a timer in the VSCode to detect which terminal to use.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Vertical Black Line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:18.034Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
- User Settings:
```json
{
    "editor.autoClosingBrackets": false,
    "editor.codeLens": false,
    "editor.folding": false,
    "editor.fontFamily": "Fira Mono Medium",
    "editor.glyphMargin": false,
    "editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity": 2.5,
    "editor.quickSuggestions": {
        "other": false,
        "comments": false,
        "strings": false
    },
    "editor.dragAndDrop": false,
    "editor.minimap.enabled": false,
    "editor.renderIndentGuides": true,
    "editor.renderLineHighlight": "all",
    "editor.rulers": [
        100
    ],
    "editor.formatOnSave": true,
    "editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters": false,
    "editor.wordBasedSuggestions": false,
    "editor.wordWrap": "off",
    "extensions.ignoreRecommendations": false,
    "files.autoSave": "onWindowChange",
    "files.insertFinalNewline": true,
    "git.enabled": true,
    "search.useIgnoreFilesByDefault": false,
    "telemetry.enableTelemetry": false,
    "typescript.check.npmIsInstalled": false,
    "window.menuBarVisibility": "toggle",
    "window.restoreWindows": "none",
    "window.zoomLevel": 0,
    "workbench.activityBar.visible": false,
    "workbench.colorTheme": "Default Light+",
    "workbench.editor.enablePreview": true,
    "workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen": false,
    "workbench.editor.tabCloseButton": "off",
    "workbench.iconTheme": "vs-seti",
    "workbench.startupEditor": "newUntitledFile",
    "workbench.statusBar.visible": false
}
```
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set Windows display scaling to 125% (and probably 2560x1440 resolution, idk if that matters)
2. Resize the VSCode window, resize the sidebar, highlight random code, and scroll the window until the black line randomly appears in between the gutter and the code-window.

I haven't been able to narrow the cause down any more than that. Here's a video of me reproducing the issue: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tchm-VDwAGA

Screenshot:
![image](http://i.imgur.com/SWUjwA2.png)

Ionide-FAKE|Ion|1.2.3
Ionide-fsharp|Ion|2.33.0
Ionide-Paket|Ion|1.7.3
Angular2|joh|2.4.0
VBScript|lug|0.0.2
Go|luk|0.6.63
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
cpptools|ms-|0.12.2
csharp|ms-|1.12.1

team|ms-|1.122.0

vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
bootstrap-3-snippets|wcw|0.1.0
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1
html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.8.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I uninstalled the 32 bit version of Code and installed the 64 bit version.
2. While using Code to edit and run SQL Server scripts I noticed that the command palette no longer listed commands prefixed by MS SQL. These are commands added to the command palette specific to the mssql extension.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2738319/29389247-03f8f202-82b7-11e7-9553-1af1b255bb03.png)
3. I checked PowerShell scripts and there are no longer PowerShell specific commands in the command palette.
4. The commands are still available and bound to key bindings. I can type Ctrl+Shift+C when in SQL script and it will still show the SQL Server Connect UI.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2738319/29389324-61709020-82b7-11e7-8576-275c23bd0f30.png)
5. I uninstalled the 64 bit version and re-installed the 32 bit version but this has not fixed the issue.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: N/A

data.title: Can't Override Whitespace Color in High Contrast Theme
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Settings
2. Set color theme to Default High Contrast
3. Add color customization for the whitespace foreground color
4. Save your settings

Whitespace remains the default white color. Other settings (e.g. line number) are able to be overridden.

```
…
  "workbench.colorTheme": "Default High Contrast",
  "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
    "editorLineNumber.foreground": "#555",
    "editorWhitespace.foreground": "#555"
  },
…
```

![screen shot 2017-08-16 at 3 40 13 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4645082/29388438-98d22420-8299-11e7-9e51-79bb2d0694b4.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.body:

- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.10.0
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
mithril-emmet|Fal|0.6.1
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
latex-workshop|Jam|3.3.2
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
vscode-file-templates|bam|1.1.0
django-html|bib|1.2.0
django-snippets|bib|1.1.0
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-quick-select|dba|0.2.4
githistory|don|0.2.3
python|don|0.7.0
prettier-vscode|esb|0.22.1
code-runner|for|0.6.33
code-python-isort|fre|0.0.3
Python-autopep8|him|1.0.2
sublime-babel-vscode|jos|0.2.6
MagicPython|mag|1.0.12
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
rewrap|stk|1.4.2
bootstrap4-vscode|the|2.4.0
python|tht|0.2.3
expand-selection-to-scope|vit|0.2.0
vscode-react-native|vsm|0.4.1
gitblame|wad|2.1.0
ReactSnippets|xab|1.4.0
extractcomponent|zuc|1.0.1
---

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
restr = r"""
    \s* \{ ( [^}]+ ) \} # directive (meta or block)
|
    \[ ( [^\]]+ ) \]    # chord
|
    \s* \#  ( .+ )      # comment - only if # is not in chord or directive
|
    ( [^[]+ )           # lyric
"""

if False:
    print("This is not properly syntax hilighted")
```



Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the enclosed hunk-o-python
2. Observe the not-syntax-hilightedness

data.title: "Tab moves focus" should not be the default
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Win7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  open new install or updated install
2.  start a new file (language doesnt really matter)
3.  type "function MyFunction"
4. hit enter
5  Type "{"  see closing brace appear
6. hit enter a few times to put blank space between the curlies
7. hit Tab to indent and start typing. 

Expected: cursor moves one tab or 4 spaces (whichever, i dont care) - and i can start typing

Actual: cursor is effectively lost. There is no visual indication of where it went, and I'm hammering the keyboard and getting ready to mothball vscode **again** when i see the green "Tab moves focus" in the status bar. 

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: `this` next to object spread in JSX element incorrectly highlighted
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.15.1 - OS Version: OS X 10.12.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. `this` next to object spread in JSX element incorrectly highlighted If you have `this` directly preceded by an object spread, the TM scope is `variable.other.object.tsx`: If you add a space between the spread and `this`, you get `variable.language.this`: Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Emmet xsl abbreviation doesn't expand correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In an xsl file, type in `xsl`
2. Expands to:
```
<!!!></!!!>
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> |</xsl:stylesheet>
```

Expected output:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
</xsl:stylesheet>
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Bug: Quick open does not include non-derived files when attempting to hide derived files in user settings.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:09:15.006Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-83-generic

Steps to Reproduce:

In user settings I am hiding derived .js files with the following settings:
```json
    "files.exclude": {
        "**/*.js": {
            "when": "$(basename).ts"
        },
```

This works correctly in the file explorer, but I cannot find any `.js` files with `ctrl+p` unless I remove this rule from my user settings.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Add navigation arrows (back/forward) for NOT pinned files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12.5)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a typescript file (or any that you can pick "Go to definition" option) without pin it as image shows.
![screen shot 2017-08-16 at 5 01 29 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5618566/29382964-b7b0042e-82a4-11e7-8df5-9fbc0ad5b963.png)
2. Go to pick definition at any type/function.
![screen shot 2017-08-16 at 5 03 37 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5618566/29382991-e098fdaa-82a4-11e7-938c-81a5ff519e9c.png)
3. You have no way to navigate back. This is annoying when you're finding definitions for third party libraries where code is distributed (calling fileA.classA -> fileB.classB -> ...), we need a way to navigate back and forward, in the same tab without opening several tabs.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature Request: Run and Run Selection toolbar
data.body:
In all of my PowerShell development, I have relied on the ISE.  In moving to VSCode, which is far superior, I find myself missing a huge time saving feature, the Run and Run Selection buttons.  I know that when you run an entire script, the small toolbar pops up with some of those buttons. When writing my PoSH code, I rarely run the entire thing until the end.  I write a piece, select it with the mouse and then hit the run selection button. Currently I have to bounce around from mouse to keyboard far to much. I know you can run a selection with F8, but I do all of my work on a laptop, where the F keys are a dual purpose type of thing.

I guess my Request in a round about sort of way, is there a way to get this tool bar to stay up permanently and include a button for Run Selection?

data.title: JSON auto indent string with opening bracket
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set language to JSON
2. Write string including `{` or `[`
3. Hit Enter

`"editor.autoIndent": false`

Object:

![obj](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9638156/29381323-70eac57e-82d1-11e7-89e8-79b23907fffb.gif)
Array:

![arr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9638156/29381332-76f9d3b0-82d1-11e7-9474-eceb490b05bf.gif)



<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Intermittent Git Smoke Test failures


data.title: Using custom TypeScript SDK broke with the latest update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.0 (8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2, 2017-08-09T20:16:18.034Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
gitlens|eam|4.3.3
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.8
debugger-for-edge|msj|0.4.1
vscode-subword-navigation|ow|1.1.5
qub-xml|qub|1.2.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.6
vscode-mermaid-preview|vst|0.5.0
wallaby-vscode|Wal|1.0.56

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

We are using a custom TypeScript SDK version that we have checked in with our code. Prior to the latest update we could do this `"typescript.tsdk": "Project/Tools/TypeScript/TypeScript-2.4.1/lib",` in our workspace config and it would use that version of TypeScript. After taking the latest update VS Code now says it can't load this version of TypeScript at this path.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

outside VSC run normal

Reproduces without extensions: **Yes** same result

data.title: Add FoldAt/UnfoldAt to fold and unfold commands
data.body:
In reference to #3598 - Added a new parameter to the FoldingArguments that is the line number. If this parameter is passed, then it will perform a fold/unfold at the line specified.  If the line number is not specified the command works as before. 

A sample call would look:

```javascript
vscode.commands.executeCommand("editor.fold", {line:1})
```

data.title: Markdown document: Dragging tab to split editor doesn't work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0 8b95971d8cccd3afd86b35d4a0e098c189294ff2
- OS Version: 10.10.5 (14F2511)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a markdown document
2. Right-click on the document in the Explorer column and choose "Open Preview"
3. Try to drag the tab of the previewed document to the right or left of the editor to split the editor view (like with any other type of document)
4. No luck

Notes:
- If you press on the "Split Editor" button at the top right, the preview tab will then duplicate to create a split editor.
- If you drag the markdown file tab (not the preview tab), the split editor functionality will work as expected.

data.title: JavaScript Does not deindent brace on next line of if block
data.body:
Follow up on https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30933

**Repo**

1. 
 ```js
if (true) |
```

2. press return and then `{`


**expected**

```js
if (true)
{
     |
}
```

**actual**
```js
if (true)
    {
         |
    }
```

data.title: fromPromise tests are flakey
data.body:
These test fail from time to time. Maybe 5ms is not always enough to wait for another setTimeout to propagate?


data.title: [Visual Studio Keymap] Ctrl+Backspace/Ctrl+Delete keys within commit message are intercepted by extension in main editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 version 1703 (build 15053.540)
- Visual Studio Keymap Version: 0.1.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Visual Studio Keymap extension and reload.
2. Open an editor with any non-empty text file.
3. Place the cursor somewhere in the middle of the text file (remember where) to observe behavior.
4. Select the Source Control tab.
5. Begin typing a commit message (does not matter if file belongs to a repository or not), and then press Ctrl+Backspace to delete a word to the left of the cursor within the commit message.
6. Observe that the open file is now dirty and the word to the left of where the cursor in the main editor was placed in step 2 is now missing.
7. In the same commit message, press Ctrl+Delete to delete a word to the right of the cursor within the commit message.
8. Observe that the word to the right of the cursor in the main editor is now missing.

Reproduces without extensions: No
